repnme.cdata!:
Mali - Obsolete Pesticides Disposal and
            Prevention Project : environment and social impact
            assessment executive summary

abstracts.cdata!:
The Obsolete Pesticides Disposal and
            Prevention Project in Mali seeks to rid the country of
            stocks of obsolete pesticides and associated wastes
            inventoried in an environment friendly manner. It has three
            components: 1. Disposal of publicly held OPs and associated
            waste and reduction of risk from priority, high risk,
            contaminated sites; 2. Limiting the accumulation of OPs and
            associated waste by consolidating the achievements of the
            Africa Stockpiles Programme; 3. Project management. This
            environmental and social impact assessment (ESIA) concerns
            the environmental and social feasibility of the sub
            component, "Disposal and decontamination of highly
            polluted sites, in particular Goundam Bambara Maoudé and
            Kara" (component 1). The "Disposal" component
            comprises the following phases: Ensuring the safety of
            pesticide stocks repackaging of stocks and safeguarding of
            facilities; interim storage of stocks; transportation of
            stocks; actual disposal of stocks. The body of the report
            indicates the many objectives and activities the project
            will consist of. The assessment was conducted in accordance
            with Malian regulations (regulatory and institutional
            framework governing the management of pesticides in Mali).

            assessment executive summary

repnme.cdata!:
Ethiopia, Mali, Morocco, South Africa,
            Tanzania, Tunisia - First Africa Stockpile Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Africa Stockpile
            Program Project for Ethiopia, Mali, Morocco, South Africa,
            Tanzania, and Tunisia were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately unsatisfactory; risk to global environment
            outcome was not applicable; Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory and borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the
            implementing agency and the World Bank team need to be
            staffed with technical expertise which is crucial for sound
            project preparation and implementation of projects
            associated with pesticide disposal. The project's
            effectiveness and development impact can significantly
            benefit from correct application of safeguard requirements.
            Sufficient time needs to be allocated for the preparation of
            required safeguard instruments. For multi-stakeholder
            projects, concise time and budget bound terms of reference
            for all partners need to be agreed on prior project effectiveness.

repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Africa First Stockpiles Program
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
This Restructuring Paper responds to the
            request of the Government of the United Republic of Tanzania
            (URT) and introduces the following changes in the Africa
            Stockpiles Program - Project 1 in Tanzania: reallocation of
            proceeds to increase the budget for disposal activities,
            which is critical to meet two of the three Project
            Development Objective (PDO)-level indicators; and extension
            from December 31, 2012 to May 31, 2013 of the project
            closing date to continue the disposal of the obsolete
            pesticides (OP) and associated waste which is being carried
            out by VEOLIA ES Limited of the United Kingdom under a
            contract in the amount US$3,402,144.28. An extension of the
            project will allow for the contractor to complete the
            shipping and disposal of all stocks, and receive
            certificates of disposal from the incineration plants in the
            UK and Poland. Without such an extension, the project would
            close with at least 80 percent of the target waste in
            transit, or awaiting final disposal in the incineration
            plants in the UK and Poland. This extension will be the
            third extension of the projects closing date for a
            cumulative period of 35 months.

repnme.cdata!:
Mali - Africa First Stockpiles Program
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the Africa
            First Stockpiles Program Project for Mali are to (a)
            eliminating inventoried publicly held obsolete pesticide
            stocks and associated waste and preparing measures for the
            future decontamination of soils in priority sites; and (b)
            implementing measures to reduce and prevent future risks
            related to pesticides and waste. The Closing Date for Mali
            Global Environment Facility (GEF) grant, which is part of
            the second phase of a regional project, will be extended
            from June 30, 2012 until December 31, 2012. This will be the
            third and last extension of the project for a cumulative
            total of 28 months. Delays occurred during the first
            extension of 22 months mainly because: (i) an abbreviated
            resettlement action plan was required and its preparation
            took time and delayed the disposal activities of obsolete
            pesticides; and (ii) the procurement of a disposal company
            for the cleanup of obsolete pesticides took longer than
            expected including the finalization of the bid evaluation
            report, as well as the approval and signing of the contract
            which had to be done at the minister level given the size of
            the contract. Then, the project was interrupted following
            the military coup of March 22, 2012 and the suspension of
            operations in accordance with which is still in effect. As a
            result, no withdrawal application has been processed since
            March 22, 2012 and project implementation has been
            interrupted, until further notice. The extension of closing
            date is necessary to allow time for the possible resumption
            of operations depending on the conclusions and
            recommendations of the Operational Procedures (OP) 7.30
            assessment mission scheduled in June 2012, and the
            finalization of all planned priority project activities
            interrupted in March 2012.

repnme.cdata!:
Mali - Africa First Stockpiles Program
            Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
As a result of pollution and to prevent
            a wider contamination of soil contamination in the Sector of
            the Plant Protection to Molodo, the specific objectives of
            Africa First Stockpiles Program Project of Mali are: Provide
            data on the site (location, access roads, immediate
            environment, addresses and contacts services and persons
            responsible for the management, security deposits, etc.);
            identify the dangers and risks posed by operations of Molodo
            on Health and Environment to Molodo; identify tasks to be
            carried out by filing and take risk reduction measures
            accordingly; provide a plan for monitoring the work and
            management of personnel involved and a plan of information
            and communication (on the site and with other parties).
            Negative impacts come as a result of injuries and poisoning
            to workers employed on the site unloading or loading of
            pesticides on aircraft, and cleaning of spray tanks.
            Appropriate training prior to the start of operations, good
            planning of operations, wearing protective equipment and
            daily checks at the end of operations, are measures whose
            implementation will ensure safety workers and prevent cases
            of poisoning.

13942382.trustfund:
TF096815-Republic of Mali: Africa
            Stockpiles Program

repnme.cdata!:
Mali - First Phase of the Africa Stockpiles
            Program Project : resettlement plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The First Phase of the Africa Stockpiles
            Program Project of Mali has four objectives: 1) to eliminate
            stockpiles of obsolete pesticides in Africa; 2) to
            contribute to the prevention of recurrence; 3) to contribute
            to the protection of human health and the environment
            exposed to Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs); and 4) to
            contribute to the conservation of biodiversity, reduction of
            land degradation and water protection. To date, this program
            is the only international and inter-agency initiative that
            has as its major function the cleaning and disposal of
            obsolete pesticides in an entire region. The project may
            cause many negative impacts including: a) The possible
            evacuation of affected populations; b) The emanation of
            odors and toxic fumes; c) The emission of dust; d)
            Respiratory damage to inhabitants; e) Contamination of soil,
            vegetation, air and water resources in case of large leaks;
            f) The risk of explosion, fire, burns and poisoning, and; g)
            Nuisance to local residents (smoke, odors, dust). During the
            implementation of the measures recommended complaints may
            arise and delay the process. Also, to address these
            situations, several procedures for resolving disputes and
            arbitration misunderstanding exist including: a) use
            amicable discussions with well-known individuals; b)
            recourse through arbitration at the municipality level; and
            3) the courts.
